metadata.title: CVE-2021-20233 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: A flaw was found in grub2 in versions prior to 2.06. Setparam_prefix() in the menu rendering code performs a length calculation on the assumption that expressing a quoted single quote will require 3 characters, while it actually requires 4 characters which allows an attacker to corrupt memory by one byte for each quote in the input. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability. It was discovered that the menu rendering implementation in GRUB 2 did not properly calculate the amount of memory needed in some situations, leading to out-of-bounds writes. A local attacker could use this to execute arbitrary code and bypass UEFI Secure Boot restrictions.

notes.note: sbeattie> grub2-unsigned will contain fixes and supersede grub2, which will contain only BIOS grub bits.

criterions.comment: grub2-signed package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.164').
grub2-unsigned package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.04-1ubuntu42').
